review_content: Bottle sample at a tasting. 2017 edition. Murky golden-orange with beige head. The aroma has notes of wood, apple, peach, lime, flowers, honey, candy. The flavor is sweet and mild sour with notes of alcohol, wood, apple, some fruitiness, a bit oxidised. Full-bodied.
Bottle at a tasting. 2017 and 2016 ed. Murky orange red. Funky, herbal, woody aromas.  Sweetish, tart, honey, wood, herbs, oxidized, wood, spicy. Medium-bodied, fizzy. Did not age well.
Bière 33 cl avec une étiquette différente de celle présentée ici. Nez frais, bouche sur la levure et légèrement acidulée. On reconnaît bien l'apport des brettanomyces. (M)

Bottle from Tesco. Gusher. Hazy amber body with a beige head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of red apple and wood. Flavour of funky yeast, caramel and oak. Medium body with a slick texture. Soft fizz. An excellent beer - tangy and very drinkable.

Butelka. Ciemny, mętny brudno miedziany kolor. Piana średnia, lekko kremowa, biała, opada szybko. Aromat jest dość nikły, owocowo-drożdżowy. W smaku, oprócz powyższych, ciemny cukier, cukier trzcinowy, drożdże, banany, trochę ziarna, trochę suszu owocowego. Wysycenie w wyższych rejonach, goryczka średnia, pestkowe. Fajne piwo
Flaska. Grumlig bronsfärgad med ett smutsvitt skum. Dofter av citrus, örter, bibliotek och jäst. Smakinslag av citrus, örter, jord och jäst. Halvtorr avslutning. Gott.
355ml bottle from Tesco - TWAT! A gusher. Murky bronze body, messy white head, Nose is grapey, vines, very yeasty. Thick lush mouthfeel, malt loaf comes through, little sour bitter finish.
Bottle, 355ml. Copper colour with a small head. A malty, yeasty aroma. Flavour is deeply malty with biscuit notes, floral hops, clove spice. Quite decent.

Bottle from Tesco for £1.85 or whatever because I am a sell out bastard. We have a gusher -splattered peverywhere like my 15 year old self. A vinous aroma with a nuttiness and low key candy sugar. Opaque amber brown. Foamy off-white head. Light sour - vinous - with underlying light-medium bitterness. Develops rich nuts  and burnt caramel as well as a herby streak. Medium bodied. Creamy. Average carbonation. Long slightly astringent finish. Enjoyable and not overdone.

Bottle at home from Tesco. A hazed onion / brown coloured pour with a lasting beige head. Small gush. Aroma is woody brett, rustic grains, rye bread, strawberry, banana. Flavour is composed of earthy grains, straw, banana yeast esters, tart bretty funk, brown leaves, mellow belgian yeast. Palate is semi tart, highish carbonation , woody tannin, highish carbonation. bitter woody finish.

355 ml bottle from Tesco, bottled 12/06/2017, bb 08/2022
Dark amber, hazy, beige head.
Nose - funk, dried fruit, cloves, other spices.
Taste - spicy, dried fruit.

Bottled 2 years prior to consumption, so do not know if that affects experience. Pours relatively uniform from bottle. No significant head to judge.  Pleasing golden nearly amber color, with nice persistent carbonation. Slightly sweet yeast smell with spice consistent with Belgian ale, but not strong. Equal pleasing and symmetric taste, but clove/spice very subtle and not appreciable to me.  Peppery tongue coating smooth mouth feel. Easy drinking for ABV but not sure would be sessionable.  Pleasing beer and definitely a nice foray into the style.
Keg at The Oregon Brewers Festival, Portland, OR on 24/07/2008.  Nice big spicy notes, with clove, cardamom and cinnamon on the nose.  Big body and lots of dried fruit and fruitcake flavours.

Beige creamy head. Deep amber colour. Aroma is hoppy, malty with fruity (apricot) and funky notes. Flavor is malty with fruity ( apricot and apple) with light spicy tones, ending in a moderately fruity and slighly sour finish. Medium bodied.

Flaska från Hopt.se. Långsam gusher. Bärnstensfärgad disig vätska med smutsvit krämig skumpuck. Brettig doft och smak. Bra kropp med rejäla maltiga och brödiga smaker, lätt syrlig, jordkällare, smutsig citruszest, kryddor. Snygg och välbyggd.

Positivement surpris par cette belge americaine! Bue ce dimanche soir tranquillement à la maison.
Brett un peu (en levure d'embouteillage) mais en restant agréable et sans acidité et rappelle l'Orval. Sympa en bouche, 35,5 cl passés facilement avec ses 7° peu perceptibles. Très bien.

Botella de 355 ml @ Saveur Biere online store. Color ámbar oscuro, levadura en suspensión, aspecto efervescente. Espuma beige, rápida disipación. Poca retención.
Aromas a levadura, manzana, uvas, malta. En boca es ligeramente maltosa, notas a levadura, miel, frutas secas.

Couleur orange foncée, rousse dorée, beaucoup de mousse à l'ouverture de la bouteille puis la mousse s'estompe assez rapidement
Nez malté, caramel, des senteurs un peu aigres et de fruits confits
Attaque ronde qui donne le ton sur des saveurs de caramel, d'épices et de sureau avec toujours cette touche aigre, acide un peu vineuse
Désaltérante avec une légère pointe d'amertume et maltée en fin de bouche un peu à la manière d'une Sour, la Matilda est relativement complexe en bouche et ne dévoile ses saveurs qu'avec une attention soutenue à la dégustation : abricots, orange amère, raisin, noisettes.
Je suis juste déçu par la touche aigre de l'ensemble un peu trop prononcée qui m'oblige à la noter en deçà de sa vraie valeur gustative et de sa complexité, sans cette touche aigre, elle aurait été quasi parfaite dans son style !

Bouteille 35,5cl

Mousse : Chapeau de mouse blanche très fine et persistante

Couleur : Orange foncé, presque ambrée

Nez : Levure très particulière, fruité, bubblegum. Note caramel. 
Bouche : Attaque ronde, fruitée, caramel. Rapidement rejoint par la saveur de la levure.  Corps rond et chaleureux, malt fruité, caramel, en fin de seconde bouche prédominance  caramel épicé et note alcool

Avis : Une basserie américaine offre une Belgian style chaleureuse, très ronde, puissante en saveurs et en caractère, sa levure interpelle. (Rappel celle d’Orval ?)

Pours clear shimmery light orange, big white head. Aroma is strong cloves, hints of raisin and dried apricots.  Taste is moderately yeasty, light tang aftertaste, hints of sweet malt, funk. Creamy but fairly light. Pretty nice.

Pours dark amber with a thin white head. Roommate did a shit job opening it. Aroma of yeast and malt. Taste has slight traces of lactose and ferrous elements that grow as the taste fades. Palate has herbal and iron notes. Interesting.
Mooie fles, mooi etiker. Bijna oranje kleur, stevig schuim. Goed gist aroma, volle smaak, zoet, maar ook stevig, kruidig. Erg goed bier.
Belgian style beer that is put well together.  Fruity flavors with mild carbonation and very week bitter finish. Not bad!
Backlog, golden orange with a medium to large head. Nose and flavor of florals, brett, barn, grass, pepper, fruit, and Belgian yeast. Medium to fuller mouthfeel with tons of carbonation.
2016 Bottle shared at home. Hazy orange appearance with thin white head. Aroma is malt and hoppy aroma. Flavour is yeast, slightly fruity and hops.

Thin off white he'd left a spotty cover on a dark golden still body.
Minimal aroma of oak & sour hints.
Bitter hoppy tastes with banana, clove, spices & light fruitiness

Goud geel bier met een mooie hoeveelheid schuim. Het bier smaakt als een echte ale, mooi bitter / granig / zoet / citrus achtig. Heeft in de smaak mooi veel diepgang en terugkerende smaken van gras en graan.
Bottle. Orange colour with white head. Yeast and fruit aroma. Yeast, fruit, hoppy, slightly sweet taste. Medium body.
Great funk that I’m searching for, I really enjoy this beer. Light golden color, slightly sweet. Love the funk!

Bottled 2015/08/14. Hazy copper with large off white head and sediment at bottom. Fills the nose of moldy basement, cheese that is aged in a cave and barn horses. Flavor is mild, and bitter with sweet lemons mixed in with savory spice. Crisp and clean in the mouth.

$2.79 bottle, Total Wine, Gainesville. I know I've had this before, don't know why I didn't rate. Pours hazy golden-amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is lemonade, funk, hay, earth. Flavor is funky lemonade, caramel malt, hay, earth, dried flowers, light yeast. Very pleasant, lots of flavor.

355 ml bottle @ home, served in a teku glass, due date: unknown, bottled: 2017/06/14

Aroma: quite intense aromas of slightly acidic white grape must, white grape, acidic wine, Brettanomyces. Some spicy overtones.

Appearance: dark orange to amber color with some copper overtones, light beige quite creamy foam, made of small to big sized bubbles. High head thickness with medium to high retention and medium Brussels' lacing. Medium haziness.

Taste: low to medium sweetness, low bitterness, low to medium sourness. Flavors of slightly acidic wine, slighlty white grapes must, fruits, citrus, spices, some toasted malts in the backend. Quite well balanced.

Palate: low to medium body, watery to oily texture, medium to high carbonation, quite long mainly dry finish with low to medium bitterness and the same previously mentioned flavors. Alcohol is very well hidden, no alcohol in the aroma or flavor and some mouth and throat warming. Low astringency.

Overall: very good looking, quite weird aromas and flavors of slightly acidic white grapes must, slightly acidic wine, white grapes, fruits, spices. Not a great fan of Brett beers, but it's quite complex, loaded with a lot of layers of flavors and not a bad beer.

Bottled 0,355L. Dark orange color, unclear and hazy aspect with ligh bubbly and foamy head of medium duration. Sweet malt and caramel aroma, sweet young wine rumors, notes of grapes, cellar, aged riped fruit. Medium prickly taste, oily texture with notes of sweet alcohol and caramel, moisted cereals, stum, clea mold, aged grapes.
Slightly hazy orange pour. A bit darker than an average blonde, and also a lot more herbal
2015 bue en 2019. Couleur ambrée, trouble. Arômes de fruits jaunes et fleurs. Longueur avec forte amertume. Dommage qu'il y ait cette forte amertume  car sinon elle aurait été parfaite.

2014 bottle into a taster showing medium amber and a finger of slightly tanned foam. 

The nose shows moderately intense notes of peach, nectarine and a harmonious note of Belgian yeast. 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Light brett and Belgian yeast with barely any sweetness. Very clean and refreshing while easy drinking like a well made saison.

5 years old bottle, thanks Jon. Darker orange pour, quite some foam there, thick and leaves good lacing on the glass while coming down. Funky tart nose, some deep dried yellow fruits, crystallised sugar there. Yeasty edge carries forward to the taste, lightly tart but feels also potent. Funky barnyard linger with light bitterness.

Colore ambrato, versa poca schiuma che svanisce velocemente. Aroma leggero con note speziate e fruttate di mela, pera  e uva. Sapore poco strutturato con note fruttate e caramellate, alcol piuttosto presente durante la bevuta. Carbonazione vivace.

Drank from a tap in Goose Island in Chicago ORD airport.

A: amber color with thin head
A: Malty scent, toast and roasted barley malt. Some scent of spice (cinnamon and clove), nuts. 
F: Abbey beer taste, malty, roasted spice and a hint of sweetness.
M: balanced finish. Not dry.
Overall: great beer to buy. Slightly lighter than other Abbey beers I had. Recommended.

Bottle from Hopt. Bretty nose. Aroma is bretty and malty with ripe (stone) fruits, toasted grain, farmhouse funk, light spicy, some caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a fairly dry finish. Body is medium. Bretty, dry and somewhat fruity, likeable brew.

Bottle shared. Bit hazy golden with small off white head. Quite some Brett, caramel, flowery notes, soft apricot, plastic, bread, soap, CO2, apple. Medium sweet and bit over medium bitter. Over medium bodied with sparkly carbonation.

Bottle at Water & Brood, courtesy of Maakun. Thanks! Hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, fruity, citrus, orange peel, light spoces, bretty. Moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body and soft carbonation. Light creamy mouthfeel. Pretty nice.

饮用日期：2018.11.24
饮用温度：5.5℃-10℃

风格：Belgian Pale Ale/Wild Specialty Beer

酒精度：7.0%vol
原麦汁浓度：15.9°P
年份：2016（765mL）
灌装日期：2016.7.19

Aroma-9/12
Appearance-2.5/3
Flavor-17/20
Mouthfeel-5/5
Overall Impression-8/10
Total-41.5/50

香气：柔和的野菌带来的杏脯、黄桃罐头气息，背景轻微明亮马厩酸臭味，麦芽味与酒花味不明显。闻香感觉就是个年轻的lambic啊，还透出些饱满甜味。

外观：深琥珀色、红铜色、山楂果汁般浑浊酒体，边缘微微泛黄，色度约12；灰白色酒头较绵密，厚度中等，持久度良好，挂杯正常。

风味：入口明亮的黄色核果香气，杏、黄樱桃、黄桃等，有适当酸味辅助，核果感更加突出，紧接着又有丝丝回甘，同时此处配合有酒花干草、辛香料风味及中等的苦味，颇有红茶的质感；仔细体会，背景麦芽支撑良好，微微面包皮味，不易发现；收口中等辛香绵延、少许矿物质感，显得中等偏干，此外酒体有微微毛刺感；余味辛香为主，少许时间后有微微麦芽焦糖味、面包皮味。

口感：酒体中等偏轻，收口感觉较干爽，杀口感中到中上、很绵密。

总体印象：一款很有意思的、用brett酵母发酵增加丰富性的比利时淡色艾尔，瓶上标识称使用了Brettanomyses Bruxellensis野生酵母。查询Ratebeer的简介，该酒与通常比利时淡艾不同的是，加入了白砂糖（个人推测用于brett二发），因此酒精度高于正常范围；另外，除二棱基麦外，使用的是焦糖麦芽而不是维也纳或慕尼黑麦芽。除了浑浊的酒体，该酒整体的平衡感符合比利时淡艾的描述，入口是高昂的果香与良好的麦芽背景，后味则偏向经典酒花的苦香、辛香，而brett酵母的运用则改变了发酵香气的纬度，使得在lambic中经常出现核果酸香出现在该酒中，赋予了酒体更加的复杂性。显然该酒的确如描述所言，是一款“农场”式的比利时淡艾，虽由美国人酿造，但比历史上来源于英国的这种风格更有“比利时特色”。

建议饮用温度8℃-12℃。

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Redstone Liquors, Stoneham. Appearance is mostly clear light copper (fine white floaties), nice sparkle, ephemeral fizzy ring of off-white head. Aroma is light bubble gum, candied fruit, spice. Taste is candied fruit, light caramel, mild tart fruit, spice. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, soft-to-average carbonation and mix of sweet and tart fruity finish. Overall, a nice sweet, fruity beer with nice complexity from the spice and tart contributions. Brett complements but doesn't send over the tart edge.
Rich, spicy, malty, sugar sweet, bitter. Hints of candi sugar, clove, saison yeast.

Bottle at home, 14/10/18.
Lightly hazed golden amber with a decent beige covering.
Nose is stewed fruits, green berry skins, light spice, toasted grains, fruit loaf, stale breads.
Taste comprises fruit cake, gentle funk, grass, white peppery spice, yeast esters, lemon rind, caramel, faint banana.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid Belgian offering.
12 oz bottle. Pours an orange brown with a thin white head. Lacing. Scents of classic Belgian yeast. Nice big belgian country taste. Well made and tasty.
(sirop orange, ~air marin, levure, ~ronde, bien foutue (fruit ~sec (abricot, raisin, orange)), but abinbevïsée : brett ?)
Arômes de bonbon a l'ouverture. Dans le verre, arômes d'épices et de fruits. Robe dorée légèrement trouble. Attaque sur des fruits et langueur assez sèche sur des céréales et levure. J'aime.

Tasty beer. However, not sure it is worth the price I paid for it. I would bring this to a dinner party because it is sweet, medium-bodied, and just delicious. I can't see paying $10 or more for a 24 oz. though.

355ml bottle @ monthly AB-Inbev tasting, Chez Sophie, July 18, courtesy of Mike. Pours clear gold, white head. Light brett on the nose. Taste is light brett, herbal notes, moderately sweet, soft spice, good drinkability, not too complex.

Great pale ale beer, not my favorite style but in an objective review tastes very very good, a little bitter and very balanced notes.

Perfect if you love pale ale
35.5 flesjes. Helder licht amber kleur, fijne romige witte schuimkraag. De geur van karamel en kruiden. Smaak is zoet/zuur, kruiden, karamel en pruimen. Medium lichaam, weing koolzuur.

14-APR-2018, draft @Goose Island Taphouse, Chicago.
Clear golden with a lasting, off-white head. Aroma is brett, sweet and fruity malt. Taste is the same. Very dry. Not as hoppy and more heavily malted than Orval. OK.
On tap. A kind of unexciting golden orange. Aroma spice, yeast, melon. Medium body. Lightly carbonated. Flavor is off dry. Esters, yeast, bread, malt, lemon flavors. Mildly bitter finish. Good.

Bottle, 2017 vintage. Spicy Belgian yeast aroma with notes of caramel malt, fruit and candi sugar. Pours cloudy orange colored with a thin off whitenhead that has good retention and lacing. Starts with caramel malt and stone fruit flavors. Finishes dry with Belgian yeast and pepper spice as well as sweet candi sugar flavors. Pretty good.

Pours a semi clear brownish orange with a thin white ring. Light aroma of Belgian spices. Starts with a nice bold taste of spices that coats the tongue and the roof of the mouth. Finishes with a slightly dry peppery warmth. Flavors of sweet cinnamon, caramel, and toast. Pretty enjoyable. Reminds me of Ommegang Gnomegang.

18-02-2018; bottle; at home (bought at Saveur Bière, as part of their February 2018 discovery box). 
The beer looks really nice. The beer has a peachy orange color, heading towards amber. A slight haziness is present it the beer. On top of the beer a nice layer of fine slightly off-white foam is formed. Foam retention is rather low. A minimal drape is left. 
The smell of the beer is nice. There are some nice sweet malt touches in there, with a slight hint of caramel. Hops don't give much...accept for a slight spicy touch though. The most of the aromas are from the yeast. They are special indeed...fruity and spicy, with that characteristic Brett touch. The last I don't rally like, since in my opinion it gives a touch of zoo. But the fruity aromas are very nice, light and fresh, with hints of plum and stone fruit. Nice. The spiciness comes with some touches of clove.
The taste of the beer is also very nice. It is filled with malty sweets and additional sweetness from added sugar. The Brett gives that zoo touch, with some sourness...I'm not a big fan of this. Hops give some bitters, whilst yeast gives both sweetness and spiciness. Especially the sweet and fresh yeasty fruits are clearly present and very nice. Banana, plum, stone fruit and a touch of clove. Very nice.
The palate of the beer is also nice. Medium body, smooth and low carbonation. The finish contains alcohol warmth, loads of funky yeast touches like fruit and spices. But also that Brett zoo touch I don't like. All in all, a nice beer. And one of the best Brett beers I've ever had.
Amber color with a slightly sweet aroma.  The taste is spicy and a little bitter, but different than just hoppy bitterness.

7%ABV. Saison.

Poured out amber. 12ºSRM.

Nose had aromas of cinnamon, cardamom, anise, sandalwood, nutmeg.

Mouthfeel was dry. Active carbonation. Flavors are hardwood, clove, bandaids, nutmeg. The malt palate had flavors of wheat flour and dried bread crumbs. Finish has lingering clove oil sensation and flavor.

Overall, a really flavorful and wonderfully complex ale. Kudos to the yeast ranchers, aka brewers!

765 ml bottle poured at home. Gift from Larry a year ago. Pours orange with a white head. Smells sweet and floral. Tastes sweet with a yeasty finish. Easy to drink. I quite like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This brewski was underwhelming. It came in a fancy bottle but did not deliver. It was bitter and had a lingering aftertaste. The bottle was not suitable to adaqute pourage. Overall was not impressed
Bottle from Beer Hawk advent calendar. Pours a rich auburn with an off white head. Yeasty, sweet, citrus and floral with spice, ginger perhaps.

12 oz bottle on 5th Jan 2018, poured into a La Chouffe stemmed tulip glass to make it feel at home (drank in California though). No sediment left the bottle, so I got a lovely clear amber bodied beer, thin white affair on top. Fairly sweet throughout with an aroma that suggests maltiness more than Belgian-ness. Taste also sweet and malty, malty molasses in fact rule the flavours. It's OK, but how it is currently a Top 50 Belgian Ale on RateBeer is beyond me; maybe some of the RateBeer guys need to actually visit Belgium before scoring this so highly; this wouldn't be in my top 100 Belgian Ales.

Bottle conditioned. Ingredients: Water, Styrian and Saaz Hops, 2-Row Barley and Caramel Malt, Yeast and Granulated Beet Sugar. Matilda is made with a rare yeast that suggests a fruity and spicy flavor. There is complex maltiness balanced with a profuse amount of hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2 years old bottle, pours amber and cloudy with some sediments, medium head with good retention, frutal aroma, sweet flavour, full body.

Sampled from a bottle at Symphony Centre, Chicago. Darkish amber colour with a big white head.Malty aroma. The taste is sweet, dominated by caramel malts and sugar, but with notes of cloves and other spices. Quite yeasty and a lot of alcohol in the taste. Mouthfeel is good. Not bad bad, but just a little too sweet and slightly undercharacterised for me.

Pours a very hazy dark golden colour with light carbonation and a thin white head which lasts well. Aromas are complex; bananas, cloves and other spices, slightly funky, some caramel. Taste is equally complex; malt fruity sweetness dominates at first alongside spicy notes. There's a slight sourness too. Sweetness well balanced by hops. Interesting, different beer.

Bottle at home in Beer Hawk advent calendar. This was a revelation. A lovely yeasty aroma to the beer and a gorgeously layered flavour that included gently sour yeast and balanced hops. This was my type of sour; one that is integrated into the beer and resulted in a delicious and complex flavour. The taste changed as the beer warmed in the glass and meant that I got something new with each sip. The alcohol was well hidden and it is certain that this beer will only improve with age. A majestic beer.

Hazy deep amber colour with small off-white foam. Aromas of blue cheese, peppers and spice like clove with sweet hints of banana. Palate, medium to light body with a thin body and high carbonation leaving boozy finish. Taste, slightly boozy with notes of peppers and banana peel. Overall, okay, alcohol not well concealed and lacks the body, rest is fine.

From the bottle. Orange, hazy, with a white frothy crown. Aroma is yeasty and full of tangerine, spices. Taste is malty sweet, lots of caramel, turning dryer on the finish. Body is medium, sticky, carbonation is mild to moderate. Overall, very good. Usually I do not regret sharing the bottle but this one I wanted all for myself.

2016 bottle from Total Wine. Pours and looks like a proper bottle conditioned Belgian. Yeast and spice aroma. Malty yeasty taste with tart stone fruits, hints of wood and nice dry peppery finish. Brett just beginning to show. Reminds me of Orval. A very good effort at a Belgian strong ale.
From Saveur biere. In Teku glass. Playing Pilgrim Academy. Not exactly a belgian pale, more like a saison, with nicely soft funk notes and some sweetness that still dont hide a champagnesque profile

Buena cerveza. Buena cerveza. Buena cerveza. Buena cerveza. Buena cerveza. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle from monks cafe sveavägen. lingering off white head. opaque solid golden color.  spicy and loght phenolic aroma. sweet malty with some alcohol.

Cerveza de muy buena calidad pero con un aftertaste algo amargo y fuerte para mi gusto .... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355ml bottle. Cloudy, orangey, dark golden to amber colour with average, frothy, moderately lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Minimally bretty, funky yeasty, minimally bready, caramel malty and fruity aroma, hints of honey, gingerbread, honeydew melon, a touch of gooseberry. Taste is moderately dry, slightly grassy hoppy, minimally bready malty, hints of honeydew melon, a touch of gingerbread and clove; slightly creamy texture, minimally sweet-ish, sticky palate. Quite manifold and complex, somehow a bit to clean and engineer’d.

Bottle from 2016. Pours a hazy copper color with a thin off-white head. Aroma of pineapple, Brett funk, light sweetness, some biscuit/cracker, maybe a hint of hops. In the end the aroma was my favorite aspect of this beer. Flavors were dominated by yeasty spicy notes of banana and clove. Perhaps a bit of cloying sweetness. More Belgian yeast and a bit of sweet biscuit, some very light gentle bitterness. Medium body, perhaps even a touch on the light side. Gentle astringency, not completely dry. A great-sounding beer on paper, but it didn’t completely come together for me. But overall not bad! Maybe a lot of people like this, what do I know?

Dull and hazy coppery-orange color with a large head of slightly off-white foam. Has a tame sweet citrus and caramel aroma. Very rich caramel and spicy, earthy tones that make this one taste like a gingerbread cookie with it’s warming alcohol in the finish.
2015 vintage. Pours a nice clear golden amber, with good white head. Aroma of fruit and sugars. Well balanced between traditional Belgian sugars and hops, this is a very nice brew. Thumbs up.

Rami Rami is drinking a Matilda by Goose Island Beer Co. at Powiśle

Taki jakby delikatniejszy orval, ciut dziki skorzanie choc nie powinien teoretycznie, mocno przyprawowy, dosc owocowy, pijalny, bdb

On tap at Sir Benedict's. Pours hazy caramel with scant cream head. Nose is banana, spice, and floral notes. Taste is similar with sweet fruitiness and clove spice balanced by hoppy and grassy flavor. Finish is a faintly dry. Body is medium. Definitely something I could drink a few of.

12oz bottle. Orange color with a white head. Floral citrus aroma. Spice floral flavour. Medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very flavorful for a pale ale, but a bit too much of an aftertaste.  Does not taste like a pale ale

Fantastic wild ale, balanced well between malts and hops. Just enough yeast and spice to let you know it's a wild. Great in many respects!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2013 -
Aroma: fruity yeast esters dominate (get some papaya, orange rind), some spices, some sweet malts and a slight funk.
Appearance: pours (into tulip glass) a medium amber with a maroon tint. a 1/4" of white head with below average retention. the beer is hazy but overly so. some minimal lacing was observed.
Taste: pronounced sweetness, caramelly malts, molasses and candy sugar. somehow balanced by enough earthy bitterness and yeast funk.
Palate: medium/full body, rich almost chewy texture, moderate carbonation, and significant astringency. Finishes sweet and long. Lingering astringency.
Overall: complex beyond a basic BPA. has not mellowed with age. still a lot going on...

Bottle from City Beer SF. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, ripe fruits, yeast, coriander and a bit of hops. Bitter finish with citrus, earthy notes, yeast, ripe fruits, hops and grass. Excellent Belgian ale.
Good, smooth, taste and smell of cloves. Something I should probably drink on thanksgiving. Very good strong beer.

2016 bottle bought in SF. Amber-brown and fizzy with little head. Nose is banana with light caramel and dry herby-spicy notes. That carries through onto the palate with a dry peppery bitterness and a nutty malt undertone. Nice.
12oz bottle pours dark orange with thin white head medium carbonation aroma is cloves and floral flavor follows suit with a bit of booze at the finish

On draft at Goose Island bar at O’Hare Airport. Poured dark amber with an abundant long lasting cream head. The aroma was floral hops, spice, and yeasty malt. The taste malt, hops, some sweetness and dark fruit. The mouthfeel was medium-bodied with good carbonation. Nice light peppery finish.

Bottle. 2008 Vintage, BBE date Sept 2013, Drank Jan 2010 - Golden in colour. Very Fruity; citrus-orange, peaches, apples. Spicy and yeasty flavor. Malty; caramel, toffee, hint of candy sugar. Hoppy; grassy and spicy hops. Sweet fruity malty throughout and very dry. Smooth, relatively mild and subtle. Enjoyed this a lot. Nice beer! (2010-01)

Noooo! I should have known: always open a 5 year old bretty beer close to the sink, not in the living room! After opening the bottle I spend the next 10 minutes cleaning the floor. The little that is left of the bottle that actually ends up in my glass is cloudy and full of sediments. The body is medium amber, and the off-white head is actually not that big (most of the carbonation escaped as I opened the bottle). Funky, sweet, sour and strong aroma of tart light fruits, apple, pineapple and leather, with some caramel in the back. Strong flavour of funky yeast, acidic light fruits, grapefruit, lemon, lemon peel and grape pits, upon a background of spices and perfume. Very little sweetness and bitterness, moderate sourness. Light and very dry body, and the carbonation that initially was explosive, ends up as moderate as I drink. A fairly nice one, but I doubt that storing the beer for such a "long" time did it any good. 

[33 cl bottle, 2012 edition, from Vinmonopolet Online]
12 ounce bottle. Has slight sweet aroma and golden amber in color. Lightly carbonated and can taste the Belgium yeast. Little sour on the palate and above average for this style beer.
Orange golden. Lots of fruit and some yeast notes. Medium bodied. Tangy fruit finish. Very nice.

Type: 16-oz. draft 
Glass: Goose Island chalice
From: Goose Island Pub at Hard Rock Casino in Las Vegas, Nev. 
Price: $8.00
Purchased: Dec. 14, 2016
Consumed: Dec. 14, 2016
Reviewed as: Belgian Strong Pale Ale
Misc.: N/A

Was staying at the Hard Rock for a work trip and had planned on heading to the Goose Island Pub once I saw that BCBS was on tap. The plan was to review Sofie and Matilda, and have a BCBS. However, once I got there I was told that they ran out of BCBS in the last hour. Bummer. Still wanted to try both beers and was actually surprised that I had not yet.

Poured a copper amber clear color with 1-to-2 fingers of frothy white head when I got it. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Decent wet foamy lacing. Below average retention. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled banana, pear, mandarin, range, allspice, cinnamon, sugary Belgian cloves and Circus Peanut candy. (Smell - 4.00)

Tasted allspice, Belgian cloves, peppery spices, banana, pear, spicy coriander, Belgian candy, grassy notes, hints or herbal and caramel. (Taste - 3.75)

Medium body. Oily-to-creamy texture. Lively carbonation. Dry finish. (Feel - 3.75)

Not as good a beer as Sofie, but glad I got to try it. (Overall - 3.75)

3.81 86 B+
aroma is of light stone fruit. dark gold in color with light head. taste is malty, of stone fruits
Flaska på Thunder Bay Grille Pewaukee. Dimmigt orange med vitt skum. Doft av citrus och belgisk jäst. En hel del jäst i smaken också med skumbanan och koriander.

Vintage 2015, consumida el 11.13.16

APARIENCIA: de color ámbar cobrizo con algunos destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa turbia pero se alcanza a ver una actividad de carbonatación mediana a alta. Corona de espuma color marfil de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas.

AROMA: El carácter del Brett bien presente, algo funky y agrio además de notas a clavo que es lo que predomina, ligeramente dulce con algunas notas a miel y cítricos.

SABOR: complejo, todo gracias a la presencia del Brettanomyces. Notas “funky” y agrias, además de pimienta y clavo que no llega a saturar, algo de gusto cítricto y dulce como miel que complementa a lo anterior. En el retrogusto queda un amargor medio ligero además de cierto gusto agrio y dulce.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio bajo, mediana alta carbonatación.

RESUMEN: excelente cerveza a la cual el añejamiento le ha sentado muy bien.
Attractive clear amber, mild carbonation and full mouthfeel. Doughy, coriander notes, finishes slightly bitter and crisp. Very pleasant to drink. Also, let’s not lie, the label is classy.
12oz bottle to tulip. Pours clouded orange, white ring head. Mod sediment. Aroma of banana, clove, funky spicy yeast. Taste of same with beets, apple and cracker.

Cor de cobre, cristalina e brilhante; espuma branca de baixas formação e persistência com pouco lacing.
Aroma de pão, biscoito e especiarias.
Sabor maltado muito agradável de biscoito doce com final seco; retrogosto seguindo o sabor com um toque de álcool.
Corpo médio, levemente sedoso e baixa carbonatação.

Deep veiled dark golden color with thick storming activity and floating detritus. Frothy beige 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with nice legs. Flavors of oak, oka cheese, banana yeast, lemon, orange, apples, pears, grapefruits, sweet grains, caramel, herbal spices. Thick fruity sweetness with a sharp sour feel. Smooth light body with crispy carbonation. Medium to strong strength finish, dry tongue coating ester fruits and citrus, thick malty and yeasty feel, with a nice barrel aged effect and bit of clove and codiander. Highly boozy and vinous yet fresh and well balanced. Quite delicious and very complex. Would serve this as an appetizer being a little bold. Overall superb quality craft.

765 ml bottle, 2014 vintage. Unclear orange copper, firmer off-white lasting foam. Spicy yeasty aroma, some citrus and clove. Taste is Belgian yeast, well spiced, some fruity citrus, spicy herbal hop, leaner malts, sweet caramel later on, fairly complex, finishes dry. Lively carbonation, medium bodied, moderately hopped. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
Een zeer lekkere geur, lekker fruitig en fris. De kleur donkerblond met een mooie kraag. De smaak is iets te artificieel.

Bottle (2014). Vibrant orange in colour with spritzy carbonation. Aromas are of horse blanket, earth, and sweet citrus peel. The flavor profile is nicely balanced between the funk, earth, brown spice, sweet malt, and mild citrus. It starts off a bit slick on the palate, but the earthy spice notes balance things out.
Bottle. Pours almost clear, golden in colour with small white head. Aroma of zest, lemons, malt and light funk. In taste lightly sweet, fruity with spicy finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Golden colour, white head. Malty aroma, yeast, reminding of Leffe. Sweet flavour, malts, banana. Sweet finish, malts, yeast and banana. Not my cup of tea.
(from 66cL bottle @ Leuven Innovation, Leuven 2015. Thanks for sharing all the beers, RateBeer crew!)
Bottle thanks to Jody. Pours pours a clear orange color. Orange and wheat nose, farts. Bitter off flavor finish.

Out of the bottle, poured a deep copper, cloudy, quickly evaporating head. I got earthy notes of brett, barnyard, mushroom and herbal tea, along with some sour cherry, orange peel and apple cider. Very funky on the palate. Lingering bitterness. Too funky for my taste, but certainly worth a try.

Bottle @ Bierkoning sidewalk tasting @ CB’16: Served in a Goose Island Mini pint taster:
Cloudy orange body with a creamy head on top.
Funk nose with some farmhouse and malt tints...
Flavour is bitter, malty, hay, toast, light card board, fruity, rubber...
Aftertaste is bitter, malty, light caramel...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel,medium bodied

Draught. Pours a clearish amber with a fading off white head. Aroma is of caramel, spice, earthy, hint of orange. Taste is of caramel, clove, ginger, yeasty spice. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Intense Belgian yeast, bread and caramel malts, sweet citrus fruits, orange, some spices. Clear gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light sweet. Bittersweet malts continue, caramel, yeast, alcohol, more spices, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice Belgian Ale, very complex aroma and plate. Keg at the brewery tap room, Chicago.

Aroma and appearance were quite suitable...as was taste. It wasn’t a memorable over the top taste though. Mild and in my opinion a bit washed out. I could drink it again if offered but not on my dime.

Lots of caramel malt in the nose with spice in the middle and yeasty background. Pours dark yellow with moderate white foam that persists. Medium body, light fizz and some slickness. The taste is a little more mild than expected but a good presence of malt, hops and yeast. Slight alcohol burn.

Poured from a bottle 1.5 years old. Smells like a Belgian Ale, with a slight hop note. Pours a dark gold colour, and very cloudy. Yeast and sediment clearly visible. Head forms but dissapears almost instantly. First sip has just a slight sourness to it, but turns to a sweet Belgian le taste. Not too sweet. Great amount of carbonation. No aftertaste. Overall one of the better beers Ive had. Will look for this again in the fall.

MB

Aroma: Medium leather, barnyard, goat, lemon, pepper, banana bread, Light floral. 
Appearance; Clear, amber body. Small, white head. Fair retention.
Flavour: Medium-leather, pepper, Medium-light sourness, medium malt, bready, banana bread, medium- yeast, banana, Light rose, strawberry. Medium-dry finish. Lingering light banana bread, pepper

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Esme and Lambert
28A. Brett Beer

Deep gold, light Amber in color with foamy beige head. A dusty dry hop scent, an interesting fusion with cigar tobacco, pine tar and rock candy. Nice feel, creamy and slightly sweet with pine needles. Goose island puts out some top shelf brews!

Cerveza muy completa que a pesar de el achool tan alto esta bien balanceada conbuen retrogusto, realmente una buena cerveza

Sample from bottle in front of ’Bierkoning’ during Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016
 Amber/orange with a white head. Aroma of yeast, sweet, orange. peach. Taste medium sweetness, malty, orange, peach, yeast, lo carbonation, medium body,

At Bierkoning during Carnivale Brettanomyces. Classic Belgian-style ale by Goose Island, with very thick and dense, towering high, creamy, egg-white head and hazy orange blonde robe. Aroma of wet leather, fermenting hay, peach, strawberry, stewed pear, bitter honey, old dry sherry. Fruity sweetish, mildly estery onset, pear, mango and slight banana, some almost Brett-like ’funkiness’, supple malt sweetness, very earthy and yeasty ending with mild herbal and leafy hop bitterishness. If this is not a (new generation) saison, then I do not know what is...

Bottle, in front of the Bierkoning at Carnivale Brettanomyces 2016, with Bierkoning, Travlr, Zlotta, Kermis, Maakun, TheJvd, ShivanDragon and more. Clear golden to amber color. Creamy off white head. Aroma’s: wort, sweet, light funk. Retronasal: sweet fruit, light funk. Flavor is moderate sweet, malty with a hint of fruity sourness. Medium bodied. Finishes lightly bitter.

Another beer that I did not have tasting notes on. Darn shame too, as it was really good. Price to pay while hanging out with family and not wanting to spend it on the phone writing tasting notes.

Will try again if I can find it out West.

Just too much funkiness for this guy... Pours a slightly orange-yellow with thin white top - looks okay. Smell is pungent - is this bret? overwhelming the Belgian yeast and zesty, spiciness. Flavor follows similarly, eventually by the end of the bottle getting used to the funk, but never fully enjoying. Mouthfeel is as expected. Won’t get this one again.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy pale amber with a fluffy white head. Aroma is yeast, caramel, spice, and coriander. Taste follows nose with faint notes of funk, plums and bubblegum. Finish is a little on the dry side. Very mild bitterness. It’s different, but nice. Pleasant drinking.

Aroma: fruity and sweet with malty, bitter undertones; Appearance: light, hazy amber with white head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: also fruity, malty and spicy; nice example of belgian ale; not too yeasty; Palate: medium-heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: very nice - would buy again.

From bottle courtesy of Maria and Vasilis. Thanks guys! Clear pale golden color with off white head. Malty yeasty and light hoppy aroma, citrusy fruity, light spicy, coriander, caramel, bread, grainy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a medium sized off white head. Funky nouse with fruit, wood and hay too. Flavour follows: Hay, wood, berries, light electrical fire, leather, chalk. Medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation, some sweetness, fine bitterness. Funky leathery finish. Good.
Bottle: Poured a burnt orange with tan head. Aroma is nice fruit and Belgian yeast. Taste is nice mix of fruit and malt.

Bouteille de 765ml (cuvée 2014) achetée dans un IGA. Dégustée en mars 2016. Bière blonde dorée foncée, limpide. Mousse beaucoup, col blanc très épais et persistant. Assez effervescente, bulles moyennes. Odeur de sucre. Un peu forte, assez sucrée, un peu amère. Saveur de céréales un peu gazonnées et de foin. Un peu biscuitée, goûte un peu les fruits tropicaux (ananas, mangue). Bonne mais pas comparable aux meilleures belges. Manque de raffinement, un peu trop sucrée.

Aroma: caramel, floral, vinous, earthy
Appearance: hazy golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour,

Delicious
Tasted at trading Post in South Sea Port NY. Good aroma but a little irony. Taste is good but not excellent.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: fruity domination and yeast notes. Sweet malt presence. Taste: medium body with nice fruity and candied fruity taste. Finish with yeast. Good attenuation. But too fruity for me and some wild yeast notes... I didn’t like it. Tap sample from BeerTemple in Amsterdsm. Clear bright orange with a fine beige head. Smells like honey, eldrflowers and a bit of farmhouse funk. Tastes like brett, honey and bitter medicine.

Draft 0.15l at Tap takeover Goose Island at The Beer Temple Amsterdam Netherlands.19.03.2016.Taste with Potjebier and Zlotta.Pour it dark hazy amber color with small white head.Aroma spice,Belgian feel but quite flat.Taste quite dry,spices,sweet fruits on the back,not typical Belgian ale and not so good balanced for my perspective.I expected more.
The aroma is funky and sweet. It looks hazy and copper. The taste it like the aroma but dry. The palate is average. Overall not great.

Bottle from the LCBO. Opens up super active, jumping out of the bottle, luckily into my sink. Pours a copper hue, off whitehead, some lace. Fades to some yeast islands. Nose is sweet, caramel, spice and fruit. Tastes bitter, smooth, sweet, candy caramel, a little bitter. Pretty damn good.
Tap at BeerTemple, 23rd March 16. Aroma is pleasant, some fresh yeast, fruit, slight hop. Taste is standard Belgian, slight spice, slight hop, refreshing. Not bad
Bottle. Light golden with 2 finger white head. Aroma slightly fruity. Taste was fruity but nothing special. Slight metallic taste in the end.

A pretty good example of a Belgian Ale -- it’s light, spritzy, and has a good amount of Belgian yeast character (fruity/bubblegum esters) and some hops at the end. It’s not as complex as the best bottles out there, but I can get this at most convenience stores, and that’s a feat in its own right.
Draft at beertemple. Golden color. Aroma of mild funk, yeast and grain. Taste is sweet, with yeast ester, grain and malt. No brett present. Meh.

Sampled from tap at ’Beertemple’. Golden amber with a tan to white head. Sweetish, fruity-malty aroma of peach, honey, vanilla and some cane sugar. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity taste of honey, peach, vanilla and cane sugar, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, moderately yeasty finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, flat. Decent.

Why not. Aroma is tart, citrus, rustic, horse blanket, some banana and clove but actually quite nice. Appearance is amber golden, white head, slight haze. Taste is horse blanket, rustic, dry, banana and clove is subtle, tart, very nice. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dry rustic aftertaste. Overall, this is surprisingly good. I typically don’t like the style, so I’m pleasantly surprised.

Aroma: zesty, pepper, peach, belgian phenols.
Appearance: hazy amber color and beige head.
Taste: medium bitterness, zesty, belgian phenols, peach, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, zesty finish.

@ City Beer 16-3-6: riktig trevlig utan att bli för kryddig och tvålig. Riktig fin smak med toner av frukt, jäst och peppar.

2/22/16 Chicago ($8 16 oz pour into vintage glass at Goose Island Clybourn Brew Pub). Mild ongoing carbonation, thin white head, orange bronze pour. Extremely sweet aroma, from berries (raspberries, blueberries), orange, lemon, peach and apricot. Taste even sweeter, and though I generally do not prefer sweet offerings, this one worked well. Cobrizo limpio y espuma marfil compacta. Aromas cítricos de brett, heno, uva, naranja. Cuerpo medio, sabor de Malta al inicio , ligero cítrico, cilantro,  final seco suave.

On tap at Goose Island Clybourn. 

Hazy golden with a white head. Sweet with malt, fruit, apicot, light yeast and some warming alcohol.
Funky fruity aroma in an amber pour. Fruity start with hints of spicy bread and bubblegum. Complex yet subtle with it. A great compliment to Sofie - albeit not quite as excellent as that brew.
Very good Belgian. Pours a dark yellow. Full malt flavor, with a crisp, carbonated finish. Flavors of sweet dried fruits - yellow raisins, maybe.
Bomber shared at tasting. Caramel golden pour. Sweet malty aroma. Taste is more Belgian yeast. Not bad.

Excellent full bodied beer. It gives you the sweet smoothness of a typical Belgium ale but with a lighter weight. It doesn't quite fill you up the way some Belgium ales can. Yummy beer

Bottle with 2013 on the label. Golden with a thick frothy head. Has lots of character that certainly hides its strength, with plenty of yeasts, pale malts, hints of fruit - very Belgian in style and very good.

Pour to 8oz nonic pint. Shrink from Whole Foods, deemed un-sellable. Bottled November 2014. A healthy, rich, clear copper pour with ephemeral head. Bright nose of belgian yeast clove with flowers and over-ripe apple, subtle banana. Flavor is clean and delicate ripe apple with smooth and tamed yeast presence. A bit sweet and juicy on the peak and finishes dry. Over a year old and it still smells (and tastes) quite nice, even to one who is not a fan of belgian yeast in ales. Getting this one for free, not a bad deal. Not the best ale I’ve enjoyed, but one of the more palatable and balanced Belgians I’ve had.
Bottle from knightly spirits, orlando, Copper color, white head. Aroma has raisins, sweet malts, some yeast. Balanced sweet taste, raisins, some plums.

765 ml bomber. Pours hazy dark gold with a small off white head. Aroma of yeast and spice, but there is a metallic smell. Taste isf sweet malt, a little caramel, with a bitter finish. Nice mouth feel, steady fine carbonation,

This is the 2014 bottled product in a 750 ml bomber. A nice medium orange amber color with sparse white head and fruity nose. The taste is complex and slightly elusive, but definitely suggestive of dried fruits. Low bitterness. 3.9.

Has some certain qualities of something great. It has a bubblegum flavor, with a bit of bananas, tastes a tad soapy. Lack some depth. Average

765ml bottle. Vintage 2015. Pours a hazy orange with a large, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that laces nicely. Pours a finger of head on a hazy straw body.

My bottle was aged 3 years, 3 months. Had some nice yeast build up on the bottom.
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey. Clear amber with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, citrus, light spice. Tastes of citrus, caramel, floral. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

I love a good bathtub beer. Something cool and refreshing always goes nicely with steaming water and soft bubbles tickling your skin. Matilda was the choice for the evening because of the style, as I’m just in the mood for some delightful funk. Here’s to hoping! - I love the delicate aroma from the neck; and pouring the beer into the tulip glass stirs a delightful combination of clove and fruit, with an earthy foundation that mellows the spice. The beer is golden amber with a minimal white head, frothy and penetrable. It clings heavy and wet to the tilted glass, and I draw a mouthful of the light-bodied brew, feeling the foam cling to my lip as I pull at the beer. The initial taste is an earthy barnyard character, a hint of banana and sweet dough that’s summed up in a dry swallow. There’s a light hops bite on my gums and the tender skin on the inside of my lips, but the dry finish eases that sting quickly. The same dryness allows the funky barnyard and nutty clove to cling to my mouth for an interminable amount of time! The yeast seems to want nothing more than to torment me; to drive me to another quaff to ease the funk and to refresh the flavors that are so complex when I exhale after the swallow. Breathe out...experience so much more. - A damn fine girl, this Matilda. I’d take her home anytime.

Bottle, shared with Justin and friends in Rome-Italy. Pours semi clear orangey color, white cap with retention. Nose: funky notes, some fruit. Mouth: bit spicy, Belgian yeast, a bit watery. Ok
